item.title: Ravindra Jadeja-Hindi Press Conference Row Leads To 'Cancellation Of A Match': Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ravindra Jadeja-Hindi Press Conference Row Leads To 'Cancellation Of A Match': Report

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

The controversy surrounding Ravindra Jadeja's press conference has led to the cancellation of a T20 match planned between media personnel from India and Australia.

  • The controversy erupted after Jadeja spoke only in Hindi during the press conference.
  • Some Australian media alleged that he avoided answering questions in English.
  • This led to a boycott of the press match scheduled for December 24.
  • India's media team denied any refusal to speak in English.
“Jadeja was asked questions in Hindi, and he decided to answer them in Hindi.”

The fourth Test between India and Australia is set to begin on December 26 at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

item.title: Ravi Shastri on how Rohit Sharma can rediscover his Test mojo - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Ravi Shastri on how Rohit Sharma can rediscover his Test mojo

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Ravi Shastri, former Indian cricketer and coach, provided insights on how Rohit Sharma can regain his form in Test cricket, particularly when batting at No.6, a position he hasn't played in years.

  • Rohit Sharma previously averaged 54.57 batting at No.6 before transitioning to an opener.
  • Shastri suggests Rohit should apply his aggressive white-ball mindset to his Test batting.
  • He emphasizes the importance of being decisive in attack rather than being in two minds.
  • Rohit is encouraged to take risks in the first 10-15 minutes to capitalize on his strengths.
  • The role of a No.6 is crucial, and effective counter-attacking is vital.
“The last thing you want is him to be in two minds whether to defend or attack. In his case, it should be attack.” - Ravi Shastri

Shastri believes that Rohit's natural game and aggressive approach will not only help him regain form but also win games for India.

item.title: BBL 2024-2025: Match 9, HEA vs STR Match Prediction – Who will win today’s BBL match between HEA vs STR? - CricTracker
item.description:
BBL 2024-2025: Match 9, HEA vs STR Match Prediction – Who will win today’s BBL match between HEA vs STR?

Date: December 22, 2024 | Source: CricTracker

The Big Bash League continues with Match 9 featuring Brisbane Heat (HEA) and Adelaide Strikers (STR) at the Gabba, Brisbane. Brisbane Heat comes off a win against Melbourne Stars, while the Strikers look to build on their recent performance.

Key Points:

  • The Brisbane Heat secured an eight-wicket win in their last match.
  • Adelaide Strikers have one win and one loss from their first two games.
  • Today's match will be held at Brisbane Cricket Ground, with a start time of 1:45 PM IST.
  • The pitch is favorable for batting, with some movement for fast bowlers.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

“Jimmy Peirson is expected to be a top performer for Heat after his unbeaten 72 in the opening game.”
“Lloyd Pope stands out as a key bowler for the Strikers with his recent performance including three wickets.”

Conclusion:

With both teams showing strengths in recent matches, the prediction favors the team batting first to secure a win.

item.title: 'Luck kaisa hai mera': Akash Deep on his battle with Steve Smith - The Times of India
item.description:
'Luck kaisa hai mera': Akash Deep on his battle with Steve Smith

Publication Date: New Delhi

India pacer Akash Deep reflects on his experience facing Australia's Steve Smith during his first tour in Australia, highlighting the impact of luck and support from Jasprit Bumrah.

  • Akash Deep replaced Harshit Rana for the third Test in Brisbane after not featuring in the first two.
  • He struggled initially but improved in the second innings, taking two wickets.
  • Deep expressed feelings of frustration regarding luck during his duel with Smith.
  • He emphasized the importance of discipline while bowling, especially with an older ball.
  • Bumrah provided valuable advice, encouraging consistency and discipline.
“When I beat him (Steve Smith) with my deliveries, for a moment, I thought, 'Luck kaisa hai mera' (What kind of luck do I have?).” - Akash Deep

This experience highlights the challenges and mental aspects of competing at a high level in cricket, especially against seasoned players.

item.title: Ravindra Jadeja Press Conference Row: Truth Behind Spinner's Refusal To Speak English Out - NDTV Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: 'Lot of players were crying, few locked themselves up...': How Pakistan's Asia Cup loss to India sparked rumours of rift - Hindustan Times
item.description:
'Lot of players were crying, few locked themselves up...': How Pakistan's Asia Cup loss to India sparked rumours of rift

Publication Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The aftermath of Pakistan's loss to India in the 2023 Asia Cup has led to significant turmoil within the team, as expressed by batter Imam-ul-Haq. He noted that the unexpected defeat sparked rumors of rifts among players, affecting subsequent performances in the ODI and T20 World Cups.

  • Imam-ul-Haq attributes the team's turmoil to the loss against India.
  • Pakistan suffered a humiliating defeat by 228 runs in the Asia Cup Super Four stage.
  • The players' confidence plummeted post-Asia Cup, contributing to later failures in the ODI and T20 World Cups.
  • Imam described seeing many players crying and some isolating themselves after the defeat.
“A lot of boys were disheartened from there. I heard a lot of them crying during the World Cup; some had stopped smiling and locked themselves up in their hotel rooms.” - Imam-ul-Haq

This incident illustrates the significant emotional and psychological impact that a high-stakes loss can have on a sports team, highlighting the importance of mental resilience in competitive sports.

item.title: Konstas won't overthink Bumrah challenge as MCG debut looms - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Konstas won't overthink Bumrah challenge as MCG debut looms

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Sam Konstas is set to make his Boxing Day Test debut against India's Jasprit Bumrah, focusing on his skills rather than over-analyzing the bowler.

  • Konstas scored 107 runs against India, securing his spot in the Test squad.
  • Bumrah has the best bowling average for overseas players in Australia, at 17.15 with 53 wickets.
  • Konstas aims to keep things simple and take confidence from his recent performances.
  • He celebrated his selection with family and expressed gratitude for their support during his journey.
"I'm super confident. Just backing my skills, I have done all the hard work. Just another game, I guess, and trying to keep it simple." - Sam Konstas

Konstas acknowledged the emotional support from his family and is looking forward to his debut amidst the excitement surrounding it.

item.title: India Women vs West Indies Women Match Prediction - Who will win today’s 1st ODI match between IND-W vs WI-W? - CricTracker
item.description:
India Women vs West Indies Women Match Prediction

Date: Sunday, December 22

Source: CricTracker

The India Women (IND-W) will face off against the West Indies Women (WI-W) in the first ODI of their series at the Reliance Stadium, Vadodara. Having recently concluded a T20I series, both teams are eager to start this ODI series strongly.

  • The match will be played at Reliance Stadium, Vadodara.
  • Kick-off at 1:30 PM IST.
  • Live streaming on Sports18 Network and JioCinema.
  • The pitch favors bowlers, making a low-scoring match likely.
  • India has a strong record against West Indies, winning 21 out of 26 matches.

Probable Best Batter: Smriti Mandhana, with 599 runs in her last 10 matches.

Probable Best Bowler: Deepti Sharma, who has taken 15 wickets in her last 9 matches.

Predicted outcome favors India to win.

item.title: "When Sundar Played Perth Test, R Ashwin Said...": Ex India Star Explains Retirement Reason - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ex-India Star R. Ashwin Explains Reasons for Retirement

Publication Date: 19 December 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Ravichandran Ashwin's sudden retirement during the series against Australia has sparked significant discussions in the cricketing community. The decision seems to have stemmed from Ashwin's recognition of his position in the team and his feelings about being dropped for key matches.

  • Ashwin shocked fans and pundits by retiring in the middle of the series.
  • Former cricketer Aakash Chopra suggested that Ashwin's decision was influenced by Washington Sundar's selection in the Perth Test.
  • Captain Rohit Sharma had previously persuaded Ashwin to continue until the pink-ball Test.
  • Ashwin felt humiliated after being dropped from the Gabba Test after performing well in the pink-ball Test.
“But when Sundar played the Perth Test, then he said, that's it, I am done.” - Aakash Chopra

The cricketing world continues to speculate why such a seasoned player like Ashwin made this abrupt choice, pointing to feelings of unvalued contributions on Ashwin's part.

item.title: South Africa vs Pakistan Match Prediction - Who will win today’s 3rd ODI match between SA vs PAK? - CricTracker
item.description:
South Africa vs Pakistan Match Prediction - Who will win today’s 3rd ODI match between SA vs PAK?

Date: December 22, 2024
Source: CricTracker

Introduction: The third and final ODI match between South Africa and Pakistan takes place at The Wanderers Stadium in Johannesburg. Pakistan has already clinched the ODI series.

  • Pakistan won the first two ODIs convincingly.
  • In the first match, Pakistan restricted South Africa to 239 runs and chased it down successfully.
  • In the second ODI, Pakistan set a monumental target of 329, leading to a loss for South Africa by 81 runs.

Match Details:

Venue: The Wanderers Stadium, Johannesburg
Date & Time: Sunday, December 22, 5:30 pm IST
Live Broadcast: Sports18 Network, Jio Cinema

Pitch Report:

The pitch at The Wanderers Stadium is generally favorable for batting, but rain may influence conditions, allowing help for bowlers. The average first-inning score is 240.

Head-To-Head Record:

Matches Played: 85
South Africa Wins: 52
Pakistan Wins: 32

Predicted Playing 11s:

South Africa: Tony de Zorzi, Temba Bavuma (c), Rassie van der Dussen, Aiden Markram, Heinrich Klaasen (wk), David Miller, Marco Jansen, Andile Phehlukwayo, Bjorn Fortuin, Kwena Maphaka, Tabraiz Shamsi.

Pakistan: Saim Ayub, Abdullah Shafique, Babar Azam, Mohammad Rizwan (wk/c), Kamran Ghulam, Salman Agha, Irfan Khan, Shaheen Afridi, Naseem Shah, Haris Rauf, Abrar Ahmed.

Match Prediction:

Prediction: Pakistan is expected to win the match.

item.title: IND vs AUS - 'We won't let Travis Head settle at the crease': Akash Deep ahead of MCG Test - The Times of India
item.description:
IND vs AUS - 'We won't let Travis Head settle at the crease': Akash Deep ahead of MCG Test

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

The Test series is currently tied at 1-1, and Team India is gearing up for a crucial match against Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, looking to secure a lead in the series.

  • India previously achieved back-to-back series wins in Australia.
  • Akash Deep highlights specific bowling strategies aimed at Travis Head.
  • The focus is on maintaining discipline and adapting to Australian conditions for bowlers.
  • After a draw in the third Test, the fourth Test is pivotal for both teams.
"I think Travis Head, in particular, struggles against short balls. We won’t let him settle at the crease." - Akash Deep

The upcoming match is critical for India as they aim for their third consecutive series win in Australia amidst a closely contested series.

item.title: World chess champion D Gukesh's mother recalls 'tough call' of not sending him to school: 'We doubted ourselves' - Firstpost
item.description:
D Gukesh’s Mother Reflects on Tough Decision to Focus on Chess

Publication Date: December 7, 2024 | Source: Firstpost

Padma Kumari, mother of D Gukesh, recounts the difficult decision to remove her son from school after grade five to pursue his passion for chess. Gukesh recently made history by becoming the second Indian to win the World Chess Championship title at just 18 years old.

  • D Gukesh dropped out of school after the fourth or fifth grade.
  • His victory at the World Chess Championship crowned him the second Indian to achieve this title.
  • Padma Kumari expressed doubts about their decision during Gukesh's performance challenges.
  • Gukesh’s recent match saw him defeat Ding Liren with a score of 7.5-6.5.
  • Padma emphasized that focusing on a singular passion can lead to success.
“This is the first time I feel we made the correct decision. He wouldn’t have been able to balance both school and chess.” - Padma Kumari

The journey of D Gukesh has not only led to a championship title but also reflects the challenges and risks faced by families supporting young talents in specialized fields.

item.title: Rohit Sharma hit on the left knee while batting in the nets at the MCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Suffers Knee Injury in Nets Ahead of Boxing Day Test

Date: December 24, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma was hit on the left knee while batting in the nets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground during a training session.

  • Rohit Sharma faced throwdowns and continued to play for a while before seeking medical attention.
  • The physiotherapist applied an ice pack to his knee amid visible pain.
  • The incident did not appear serious; precautions are being taken to reduce any swelling.
  • Other players participated vigorously, including Jasprit Bumrah and Virat Kohli.
  • The fourth Test of the Border Gavaskar Trophy begins on December 26, with the series currently tied at 1-1.
“Such blows are common when you play cricket... I think this wicket was for white ball which is why the ball was staying low.” - Akash Deep

As the Indian team prepares for the upcoming Test, they remain hopeful for Sharma's quick recovery.

item.title: 'Wasn't looking to save follow on, mindset was...': Akash Deep on Gabba Test heroics with Jasprit Bumrah - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Akash Deep Reflects on Gabba Test Heroics with Jasprit Bumrah

Date: Dec 22, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

In a thrilling encounter at the Gabba, Akash Deep's performance with the bat in crucial moments helped India evade a follow-on against Australia, contributing to a dramatic draw that keeps the series level.

  • Akash Deep debuted in the third Test, replacing Harshit Rana.
  • He scored 31 runs off 44 balls, forming a critical 47-run stand for the tenth wicket with Jasprit Bumrah.
  • The partnership was pivotal in ensuring India avoided a follow-on, preserving their chance in the series.
  • Akash emphasized his mindset was to simply bat without getting out, leading to a confidence boost within the team.
  • He credited Jasprit Bumrah for his guidance during the match.
“I wasn't looking to save the follow-on that day; I was just looking not to get out.” - Akash Deep

The team's spirit was high following the match, showcasing the collaborative effort in a challenging scenario against a strong opponent.

item.title: "When Your Mother Was Hospitalised...": PM Narendra Modi's Glorious Tribute In Letter To R Ashwin - NDTV Sports
item.description:
PM Modi's Heartfelt Tribute to R Ashwin on His Retirement

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

Prime Minister Narendra Modi penned a heartfelt letter to Indian cricketer R Ashwin following his retirement, praising his contributions to cricket and the emotional impact of his decision.

  • Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement mid-way through the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • PM Modi expressed surprise at the retirement, likening it to a 'carrom ball'.
  • The letter reflected on Ashwin’s significant achievements and the legacy he leaves behind.
  • Modi highlighted Ashwin's dedication, including a memorable instance when he played despite his mother being hospitalized.
  • The letter congratulated Ashwin for his illustrious career and contributions to Indian cricket.
“Your sincerity and commitment came to the fore … even when your mother was hospitalised.”

This tribute underlines not just Ashwin's cricketing skill but also his character and the deep emotional connection he built with fans and teammates alike.

item.title: "You Bowled A Carrom Ball": PM Modi Writes Emotional Letter To R Ashwin On Surprising Retirement - NDTV Sports
item.description:
PM Modi Pens Heartfelt Letter to R Ashwin Following Retirement

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement from international cricket has surprised fans worldwide. Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his gratitude and admiration for Ashwin’s contributions through an emotional letter.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • PM Modi likened Ashwin's retirement to a 'carrom ball', reflecting the unexpected nature of the decision.
  • The letter highlights Ashwin's remarkable achievements, including the highest number of Player of the Series awards in Test matches.
  • Modi acknowledged Ashwin's contributions both on and off the field, including his adaptability and cricketing intelligence.
  • The letter encourages Ashwin to continue contributing to the game he loves.
“Your retirement announcement surprised fans in India and across the world... this must have been a hard decision for you as well.” – PM Narendra Modi

In conclusion, PM Modi's heartfelt letter celebrates Ashwin's illustrious career and looks forward to his future contributions to cricket.

item.title: Virat Kohli needs 134 runs in fourth Test to script history; will surpass Sachin Tendulkar record to become… - Crictoday
item.description:
Virat Kohli Aims to Surpass Sachin Tendulkar's Record in Fourth Test

Publication Date: December 26, 2024 Source: Crictoday

India and Australia are currently engaged in a five-Test series Down Under, with the score level at 1-1 after three matches. Virat Kohli is on the brink of establishing a major record at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

  • Virat Kohli needs 134 runs in the fourth Test to surpass Sachin Tendulkar's record.
  • India and Australia are tied at 1-1 in the series after three matches.
  • Kohli has scored 316 runs at the MCG, while Tendulkar holds the record with 449 runs.
  • Kohli's scores in the series include a 100 and several low performances.
  • The Boxing Day Test is crucial for Kohli's career and his team’s prospects.
"Kohli started the series with 5 in the first innings at the Optus Stadium in Perth, followed by an unbeaten 100 in the second innings."

The fourth Test presents a vital opportunity for Kohli to etch his name in cricket history by breaking a long-standing record.

item.title: Robin Uthappa breaks silence after arrest warrant issued against him in EPF deposits fraud case: 'Had no role...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Robin Uthappa Addresses Arrest Warrant in EPF Fraud Case

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Former India cricketer Robin Uthappa has spoken out after an arrest warrant was issued against him regarding an alleged fraud involving Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) deposits, claiming he had no executive role in the companies involved.

  • Uthappa asserts he was a director due to financial contributions but not involved in day-to-day operations.
  • The arrest warrant was issued for failure to remit dues impacting workers' provident fund accounts.
  • Uthappa is currently residing in Dubai with his family.
“Regrettably, these companies failed to repay the funds I lent them, leading me to initiate legal proceedings.”

This situation has drawn significant attention, especially due to the implications for affected workers and the legal proceedings that will follow.

item.title: Rohit Sharma hit while batting in the nets at the MCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Injured During Nets Session at MCG

Date: December 2023 | Source: Times of India

Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma was injured while batting in the nets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, raising concerns ahead of the Boxing Day Test.

  • Rohit was hit on his left knee by a throw from a specialist during practice.
  • He sought attention from the team's physio after feeling pain.
  • The blow was not deemed serious, and precautions were taken to manage any potential swelling.
  • The Indian team is preparing for the fourth Test of the Border Gavaskar Trophy, which starts December 26.
“The blow didn’t look that serious, and the physio is taking precaution to ensure swelling, if any, subsides.”

Rohit hopes to recover quickly before the important test match.

item.title: Australian media misbehaves with Team India, spreads absurd lies about Ravindra Jadeja: Here's what actually happened - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Australian Media Misbehaves with Team India, Spreads Absurd Lies About Ravindra Jadeja

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: HT Sports

The article debunks false claims made by the Australian media regarding Ravindra Jadeja's press conference, where he was accused of refusing to answer questions in English. It provides a detailed clarification of the events, countering misleading statements and highlighting the rudeness displayed by some Australian journalists.

  • The Australian media falsely claimed that Jadeja refused to answer questions in English.
  • In reality, Jadeja answered questions in Hindi, as they were posed in that language.
  • Another claim suggested Jadeja had to leave for the team bus, which he never said.
  • The press conference was primarily for Indian media, which was communicated beforehand.
“At no stage did Jadeja refuse to answer in English.”

This controversy comes amidst growing tensions surrounding the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, now tied at 1-1, highlighting not just on-field rivalries but off-field frictions as well.

item.title: Barcelona player ratings vs Atletico Madrid: Blaugrana’s title bid takes serious hit as dismal Fermin Lopez & Marc Casado let magical Pedri down in stoppage-time heartache - Goal.com
item.description:
Barcelona Player Ratings vs Atletico Madrid: Title Bid Takes a Hit

Publication Date: N/A Source: Goal

Barcelona suffered a painful stoppage time defeat against Atletico Madrid, losing 2-1 and dropping from the top of La Liga as they failed to capitalize on their lead.

  • Barcelona started strong but fell victim to Atletico's counter-attacks.
  • Pedri scored the opening goal but Fermin Lopez and Marc Casado's poor performances contributed to the defeat.
  • Atletico Madrid's Sorloth scored the winner in stoppage time, marking their first away league win against Barcelona since 2006.
  • The loss capped a disappointing night for Barcelona, who were frustrated in their attempts to break down Atletico's defense.
“Sorloth emphatically rounded off a rapid counter-attack to break Barca hearts.”

The defeat is a significant setback for Barcelona in their title bid, demonstrating vulnerabilities in their performance.
